description: Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney with the day’s top news…Today’s must-reads:• Economic malaise • Spies warn about China• A victory for Musk
title: Anemic Economy

description: Former President Donald Trump posted his first video to TikTok on Saturday, and has already amassed more followers and likes than President Joe Biden’s campaign account as the two men vie for attention before November’s general election.
title: Trump Quickly Surpasses Biden on TikTok With Just One Video

description: After scaling the 30-foot border wall south of San Diego during the early morning hours on Wednesday, 42-year-old Santiago Montenegro arrived at an open-air detention site cold, hungry and exhausted from the long journey he’d been on since leaving his native Colombia.
title: Migrants Unaware of Biden Order Keep Streaming Into San Diego

description: Boeing Co. Chief Executive Officer Dave Calhoun will face a bipartisan inquiry into the planemaker’s safety practices and culture when he testifies before the US Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, congressional leaders said Wednesday.
title: Boeing CEO to Testify Before Senate Panel Examining Safety Gaps

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics reporter Gregory Korte looks at how Trump campaign ad spending shows where they think the race will be won. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Allies Give a Peek at State Strategy With Ad Spending Plans

description: Hunter Biden’s lawyer sought to attack firearms charges against his client by arguing the president’s son may have been lying in text messages about his illegal drug use and that key witnesses couldn’t know whether he was under the influence when he bought a gun.
title: Hunter Biden Defense on Gun Charges Focuses on Lying, Not Drugs

description: Argentina President Javier Milei’s sprawling package of pro-market reforms is at risk of losing its most significant fiscal chapters during a tense Senate vote next week.
title: Argentina’s Senate Poses Fresh Challenge to Milei’s Reform Bills

description: Hedge fund giant Bridgewater Associates now has two former top executives running for the US Senate this year on the Republican ticket, as former chief financial officer Nella Domenici won the party’s Senate primary Tuesday in New Mexico.
title: Hedge Fund Giant Bridgewater Now Has Two Ex-Officers Running for Senate

description: Venezuela’s opposition is ramping up lobbying efforts in Washington, trying to persuade the Biden administration to intervene in the court-ordered sale of Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s parent company in the US.
title: Venezuela Opposition Presses Top US Officials to Halt Citgo Sale

description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia holds 6,465 Ukrainian prisoners of war, while 1,348 Russians are being held by authorities in Kyiv.
title: Putin Says Russia Holds 6,465 Ukrainian Prisoners of War

description: Donald Trump will speak at the Business Roundtable, an organization for chief executive officers of large US corporations, as the presumptive Republican nominee moves to expand his outreach to business leaders despite his recent felony conviction.
title: Trump Will Speak at Meeting of Prominent CEOs Weeks After Conviction

description: Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison and Elliott Investment Management’s Paul Singer, are among deep-pocketed donors to a political advocacy group with close ties to Tim Scott, a Republican senator, whom Donald Trump has floated as a potential running mate.
title: Billionaires Back Tim Scott as He Auditions for Trump’s VP

description: First Minister of Wales Vaughan Gething lost a non-binding vote of no confidence on Wednesday, in a blow to his Labour Party which runs the devolved government.
title: Welsh Labour Leader Loses Confidence Vote in Blow to Starmer

description: The return of Brexit architect Nigel Farage as leader of Reform UK and a candidate in next month’s general election has seen the right-wing party close to within just two points of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives, threatening a dire election result for the premier, a new poll by YouGov showed.
title: Farage’s Return Sees Reform Party Close on Tories, YouGov Says

description: Indian voters are frustrated by an economic boom that has created a billionaire elite — and left 600 million residents behind.
title: Billionaire-Friendly Modi Is Punished by Millions of Poor Voters

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, who was injured in May 15 assassination attempt, said he hopes to return to work at the end of this month or in July.
title: Slovak Premier Expects to Return to Work in Weeks After Shooting

description: Labour leader Keir Starmer accused Rishi Sunak of “deliberate lies,” after the prime minister used the first TV debate of the UK election campaign to claim his poll-leading rival was planning to raise taxes.
title: Starmer Accuses Sunak of Lying With Tax Attack as UK Vote Sours

description: Euro-area finance ministers gave political backing Wednesday to an effort by Group of Seven nations to provide loans to Ukraine using windfall profits generated from immobilized Russian central bank assets.
title: Euro-Area Finance Chiefs Back G-7 Push on Frozen Russian Assets

description: The South African Communist Party will oppose the formation of a government by the African National Congress that includes the Democratic Alliance and the uMkhonto weSizwe Party.
title: South African Communist Party Wants Government That Excludes DA and MKP

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived in Qatar to promote a summit about his blueprint for peace amid uncertainty over the number of countries from the so-called Global South that will attend the event.
title: Zelenskiy Visits Qatar to Seek Support for Ukraine Summit

description: A super political action committee supporting Donald Trump raised $70 million in May and is outlining a strategy to target voters in key swing states in the coming months, a sign of how Republicans are seizing on the surge in donations following the former president’s conviction in a New York court.
title: Trump Super PAC Rakes in $70 Million, Plans to Spend in Georgia

description: China’s effort to recruit retired Western military pilots to train its air force continues unabated, the US and four allies warned Wednesday in a rare joint bulletin, suggesting Beijing is undeterred despite repeated efforts to clamp down on the practice.
title: China’s Quest for Western Pilots Is Unabated, Allies Warn

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said a controversial plan to divert incoming migrants to Albania would move forward this summer as she defended a project that’s become central to her European election campaign.
title: Meloni Says Controversial Albania Migrant Plan to Move Forward

description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner announced plans for €23 billion ($25 billion) in income-tax relief for households through 2026 even as he wrestles with his coalition partners over how to plug a hole in next year’s budget.
title: Germany’s Finance Minister Promises Tax Cuts Worth $25 Billion

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi won crucial backing from two key allies in his coalition, allowing him to form a government and extend his decade in power.
title: Modi Secures Coalition Support, Handing Him Third Term in Power

description: Russia’s oil proceeds to the state budget increased almost 50% in May from a year ago, as its crude prices rose and the nation adapted to international sanctions.
title: Russia Oil Revenue Rose 50% in May as Nation Adapts to Sanctions

description: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog is preparing to pass a resolution of censure against Iran, deepening a diplomatic rift over the Islamic Republic’s contested nuclear program.
title: Iran Censure at Nuclear Watchdog Signals Deeper Diplomatic Rift

description: Finland called for the European Union to procure a vessel to be on standby for oil spills in the northern parts of the Baltic Sea, as Russian crude transports are posing a growing threat in the region.
title: Finland Wants EU Oil-Spill Vessel to Counter Shadow Fleet Risks

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul is considering delaying a plan to charge motorists driving into midtown Manhattan and potentially replacing it with a tax on New York City businesses, according to a person familiar with the situation who requested anonymity because the proposal hasn’t been made public.
title: NYC Congestion Pricing Risks Delay After Hochul Weighs Pause

description: The combined impact of climate change, population growth and poor resource management has created a crisis.
title: Mexico City Wealthy’s Favorite Lake Getaway Is Drying Out

description: Increased polarization and norm-shattering events like the felony conviction of Donald Trump make the 2024 elections the most challenging US political environment for companies at any point in recent memory, according to a new report.
title: Even Corporations Say the 2024 Political Climate Is Terrible

description: South Africa’s African National Congress has begun talks with its rivals on the formation of a new government after last month’s elections failed to produce an outright winner.
title: ANC Engages Rivals on Forming New South African Government

description: South African assets were among the world’s worst performers on Wednesday, after the African National Congress said it’s considering a government comprising several parties, rather than a tie-up with the business-friendly Democratic Alliance.
title: Rand Drops With Favored Coalition Outcome Seen in Backseat

description: South African Sports, Arts and Culture Minister Zizi Kodwa was granted bail of 30,000 rand ($1,593) in a Johannesburg court on Wednesday after appearing on charges of corruption.
title: South African Minister Kodwa Granted Bail in Johannesburg Court

description: Rishi Sunak has failed to make a dent in the large polling lead enjoyed by Keir Starmer’s Labour Party in the first two weeks of the UK general election campaign, suggesting the premier and his governing Conservative Party remain on course for a landslide defeat.
title: Sunak’s Hail Mary Plan to Cut Poll Gap to Labour Falls Flat

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: South Africa Stands at the Crossroads

description: The Netherlands may contribute as much as €3 billion ($3.26 billion) for the green transformation of Tata Steel Ltd.’s IJmuiden factory, which has caused serious health and environmental problems in the surrounding area.
title: Dutch May Pay as Much as €3 Billion to Clean Up Tata Steel Plant

description: Two conservative groups are using separate legal strategies to achieve the same goal—use the courts to thwart diversity programs.
title: Conservative Duo Wants to Take Down Diversity Programs One Bias Claim at a Time

description: The venture capitalist hosting a $300,000-a-head fundraiser for the former president has carved out a role for himself among Silicon Valley’s political right.
title: David Sacks Tried the 2024 Alternatives. Now He’s All-In on Trump

description: Justice Samuel Alito’s flag-flying controversy has reignited the political firestorm over the US Supreme Court, just as it prepares to issue a blizzard of high-stakes rulings topped by a clash over Donald Trump’s bid for immunity from prosecution.
title: Alito’s Flag Controversy Foreshadows Contentious US Supreme Court Rulings

description: The US and South Korea conducted joint bombing drills using a type of precision munition for the first time in about seven years, in a show of force after Seoul scrapped a 2018 deal with North Korea to reduce tensions at the border.
title: US, South Korea Warplanes Put on Show of Force for Kim Jong Un

description: Germany will order an additional 20 Eurofighter aircraft as part of a multi-billion euro push to strengthen the nation’s armed forces, according to Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
title: Germany to Buy 20 More Eurofighters in Military Expansion Drive

description: The Lebanese army said it arrested a gunman who fired shots at the US embassy north of the capital.
title: Gunman Fires Shots at US Embassy in Lebanon, Army Says

description: Police in Hong Kong arrested a woman for chanting slogans on the anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown, using a new domestic national security law for the first time on a protester.
title: Hong Kong Arrests Protester With New Security Law for First Time

description: In June of last year, a Russian cybercrime gang called BlackCat hacked the Barts Health NHS Trust, a part of the UK’s National Health Service that operates several hospitals in London, and published some of it online in an extortion attempt.
title: Hack That Crippled London Hospitals Is Only the Latest to Hit UK

description: The Irish government needs to show restraint when setting its next budget or risk overheating the economy, the state’s fiscal watchdog has warned.
title: Ireland Must Show Restraint in Next Budget, Watchdog Warns

description: The president’s efforts to revive French industry to meet the challenges of the climate transition aren’t convincing voters who have turned to the far right.
title: Macron’s Charms Falter in Le Pen’s Industrial Heartland

description: Conservatives insist on making immigration a core campaign issue while consistently missing their own targets to restrict it.
title: Tories Can’t Hide From Their Failures on Immigration

description: Vladimir Putin turns his native St. Petersburg into the heart of power for his flagship economic event this week. Increasingly, the gathering in Russia’s former imperial capital is becoming a generational showcase for the children of the Kremlin elite.
title: Putin’s Flagship Forum Offers Stage to Children of Russian Elite

description: The Swiss are getting ready to vote on whether to curb the personal costs of a health system that charges its users more than in any other country in Europe.
title: Swiss Vote on Europe’s Highest Health Costs in Debate Echoing US

description: Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s administration is discussing ways to exert more control over the country’s central bank after repeatedly clashing with the monetary authority on economic policy, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Thai Government Eyes Tighter Grip on Central Bank After Spat

description: Mexican opposition leader Xochitl Galvez said she will ask the electoral authority to recount 80% of the votes from Sunday’s election, in which she lost the presidency to ruling party candidate Claudia Sheinbaum.
title: Mexico’s Galvez to Ask Electoral Body to Recount 80% Votes

description: Indonesian President-elect Prabowo Subianto is planning a new government agency to tackle the nation’s longstanding problems with clean water access as part of his national security policy, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Prabowo Plans Water Agency as Part of Indonesia Security Policy

description: President Joe Biden is planning a pair of meetings with Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy in the coming weeks, looking to telegraph US solidarity with Kyiv despite plans to skip an upcoming peace summit in Switzerland.
title: Biden to Meet Zelenskiy in Italy, France Despite Skipping Summit

description: Rishi Sunak reached for a tried-and-tested Conservative weapon in his first UK election campaign debate with Keir Starmer, repeatedly warning that the Labour leader would raise taxes. But their heated prime-time TV clash showed up the prime minister’s own weaknesses as much as his opponent’s.
title: Sunak Hits Starmer on Tax, But Loses on Likability in UK Debate

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is gearing up for coalition talks after his party lost its majority in parliament, forcing him to rely on allies to form a government for the first time since he stormed to power a decade ago.
title: Modi Seeks to Shore Up Coalition to Secure Third Term in Power
